title: The Names We Carry
tagline: A family's buried shame becomes a young man's inheritance in postcolonial Singapore.
themes: Silence as a Form of Violence
The Physical Archive as Family Trauma

chapters.title: The Ghost of Tan Hock Seng

story: Write a scene where a character from a younger generation discovers a physical object (a letter, a photo, a tool) that contradicts the family's official story about an ancestor.
Imagine a conversation between Kai and a contemporary friend who sees his family's shophouse not as a treasure, but as a burden holding them back from modern success.
Draft a monologue from the perspective of Wee Teck, explaining his shame and his strategy of silence to a confidant he will never have.
Create a 'found document'—a ledger entry, a ration order, a faded letter—from Tan Hock Seng's time that reveals a moral dilemma he faced.
technical: Build an interactive 'archive' website for the novel, where users can click on items in a 3D model of the rosewood cabinet to reveal fragments of ledgers, letters, and historical context.
Develop a text analysis tool that compares the language and syntax used in dialogue by the three generations (Kai, Li An, Wee Teck) to visualize their emotional and ideological distances.

cover_prompt: A young man in a modern apartment, his back to the viewer, holds a crumbling, handwritten ledger while gazing at a ghostly, translucent overlay of his grandfather in a 1940s office, formally shaking hands with a British officer, [Detailed Scene & Context: the spectral historical scene is superimposed over the contemporary Singapore skyline visible through a rain-streaked window, with archival documents and faded photographs scattered across a minimalist desk], [Artistic Style & Medium: in the atmospheric, emotionally charged style of a Minguelanxo Prado graphic novel illustration, with the textural depth and solemn realism of a Kent Monkman history painting, rendered in detailed ink wash and muted watercolor], [Composition & Camera: book cover framing, a centered but split composition where the past and present occupy the same space, shot from a medium close-up, slightly low angle to emphasize the weight of the gaze], [Lighting & Color Palette: dramatic chiaroscuro lighting with a single stark light source from the window, casting long shadows; a palette of sepia tones for the past, cool, desaturated blues and greys for the present, with accents of faded red ledger ink], masterpiece, best quality, ultra detailed, intricate details, professional composition, sharp focus, 8k resolution, flux dev.
